trial_identification.studytitle: The role of Gabapentin in the treatment of refractory chronic dry cough.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The role of Gabapentin in the treatment of refractory chronic dry cough: A randomised double-blind placebo-controlled study.

interventions.interventions: 300 mg of oral Neurontin once per day, then increased to 600mg/d for second day, then 900mg/d for third day upto maximum tolerable dose of 1800mg/day for ten weeks.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Improvement in cough quality of life by Leicester Cough Questionnaire (LCQ)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: baseline, during treatment visit (week 8) end of treatment visit (week 12) and post treatment visit (week 16).

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: baseline, during treatment visit (week 8), end of treatment visit (week 12) and post treatment visit (week 16).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Decrease in cough frequency by cough monitor recording
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: baseline, during treatment visit (week 8), end of treatment visit (week 12) and post treatment visit (week 16).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Improvement in cough severity by Cough visual analogue scale (vas)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: baseline, during treatment visit (week 8), end of treatment visit (week 12) and post treatment visit (week 16).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Persistent non-productive cough of more than 8 weeks duration, Male or female between ages of 18 and 80 years, Non-smoker or ex-smoker with less than 10 pack years, To have been well during the 4 weeks prior to study entry, Informed consent obtained.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Productive cough, Current smoker, Smoking history >10 pack years, Pregnancy/breast feeding, Other respiratory disease, eg: bronchiectasis, COPD. Inability to attend study visits Respiratory tract infection during month prior to randomisation Impaired liver function at Visit 1 as shown by Aspartate aminotransferase (AST), an enzyme normally present in liver and heart cells and alanine aminotransferase (ALT). If the liver is injured, the liver cells spill the enzymes into blood, raising the enzyme levels in the blood and signaling liver damage. Therefore, an AST, ALT, alkaline phosphatase or total bilirubin greater than 2 times the upper limit of normal will exclude a participant.

trial_design.concealment: allocation concealment-central randomisation by computer to pharmacy for active or placebo allocation to subject whois along with the investigators blinded to allocation.
